Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav scored a fine half-century
Rishabh Pant and Virat Kohli led a solid recovery
Rashid Khan struck thrice in as many overs
Suryakumar did explode for his second fifty of the competition
Hardik Pandya played a good hand, hitting 32 off 24
Fazalhaq Farooqi and Rashid took 3 wickets each
India posted 181 runs for the loss of 8 wickets
Afghanistan was bundled out for 134 runs
Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh registered three-fers
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma won the coin toss and decided to bat first
Kuldeep Yadav came in, replacing Mohammed Siraj
Afghanistan had one change â€“ Hazratullah Zazai replaces Karim Janat
Rohit said the pitch looked good and expected it to slow down
Rashid said they were happy with their preparations and needed to control emotions
India's playing XI included Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, and Jasprit Bumrah

Afghanistan's playing XI included Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Ibrahim Zadran, Najibullah Zadran, Hazratullah Zazai, Gulbadin Naib, Azmatullah Omarzai, Mohammad Nabi, Rashid Khan (captain), Noor Ahmad, Naveen-ul-Haq, and Fazalhaq Farooqi
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day
The game went into 15 innings before a decisive home run by Mike Trout (Note: This is incorrect as it refers to a different match)
